entry.title: Re: "Project Manager" Field in Project Control - Enterpri...
entry.content:
Hello @manickath 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

In SAP EPPM Public Cloud, the Project Manager field in Project Control Enterprise Projects shows all business users by default.
To limit this to a small set of users, for example a range of 3-4

Please note that direct filtering is limited in Public Cloud but you can control it via role assignments. Only assign the Project Manager role to desired users.

Alternatively, you can use Field Control or a custom CDS view or UI adaptation if available to restrict the list.

On‑premise offers you more customizing options e.g., SPRO à PPM à Field Control, whereas in Public Cloud role‑based filtering is the practical approach.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Simple Signavio Question about Audiences and One abou...
entry.content:
Hi,

you can link a user group to your new Audience and customize in Settings (Collab Hub Settings) what this Audience gets to see. There are quite a few set-ups related to Audiences. And to answer directly to your questions: the users of an Audience can see the content set up for this Audeince. But there can be users that are part of more groups and if these groups are linked to different Audiences, than the users will be able to change between the Audiences.

You can create the groups yourself(as  Admin), in this case you would create the group according to your business unit and add the members of your business unit to this group. As well you can set up their user rights with what they are allowed to see or which actions are they allowed to do. I recommend to establish a concept for user rights before starting all this.  

Regarding SSO, I have tried both alternatives with and without groups, the one with groups always had issues, this was some time ago, maybe it was fixed by now.  you can work with groups, you need to set this up in your IdP.  You can find all instructions in SAP Help. 

I hope I could help! Best

Rada

entry.title: Re: CDS/API/BADI to populate CUP and CIG fields in Itly t...
entry.content:
Hello @Gahan_Narayan1 

The Italian-specific CUP (Codice Unico di Progetto) and CIG (Codice Identificativo Gara) fields on the PO item › Italy tab are not yet exposed in any released artefacts, no public CDS view, no released OData API for PO items, and no PO-item BAdI parameters to read or write them. That’s why you cannot find them, and why they cannot be populated programmatically from a contract or requisition today. Entry remains manual in the UI.

You are not exposed to;

  • Any released CDS view
  • API_PURCHASEORDER_PROCESS_SRV or other public APIs
  • PO-item level BAdIs

They are UI-only fields, so they can’t be populated programmatically from PR/Contract.

Possible Workaround:

  • Create custom fields YY_CUP / YY_CIG on PR/Contract/PO via Custom Fields and Logic.
  • Use standard field transfer or MM_PUR_S4_PO_ITEM (Determine Fields) BAdI where available for custom fields.
  • Use custom CDS views/queries for reporting and include in PO output forms.

If the standard CUP/CIG population is mandatory:

Raise an SAP incident requesting these fields be:

  • Added to a released PO-item CDS view
  • Exposed in API_PURCHASEORDER_PROCESS_SRV
  • Available in a released PO-item BAdI

SAP Help – CUP and CIG Fields in Italy Localisation for Purchase Orders: explains field purpose and manual maintenance in Public Cloud.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: FG TO RM NORMS CONSUMPTION
entry.content:
Consider the below tables to develop a custom report

  1. To start with FG material, use MAST to get BOM number (STLNR) for the FG
  2. For BOM Header, use STKO with STLNR to get BOM usage, plant, etc.
  3. For BOM items, use STPO with STLNR to get RM components and quantities
  4. For each RM in STPO, check if it is SFG. If yes, repeat steps 1–3 above to explode its BOM
  5. Continue until all leaf-level RMs are reached

entry.title: List Item Not Repeating Data in SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I'm trying to create a simple list view to display the item's warehouse availability, similar to how SAP B1 does in the Stock tab of Item Master Data in SAP Business One.

In there, basic fields such as warehouse code, in stock, committed, and ordered. The input comes from a scanned barcode, which in turn is associated with the Item Master. Fetching header-level data is fine. I managed to get Item Code, Item Name, and I could get any other data from the same level. But when it comes to nested data, in this case, warehouse data related to the item, I got stuck. I describe how I set up the data source and how I am managing data/page variables:

Data Source

In this system, we are using SAP Cloud Connector to link BTP to our On-Premise landscape. We created a destination called SBOSL, which points to the Service Layer root endpoint, whereby all exposed entities can be used. SBOSL then gets available as data source in SAP Build Apps, and all I had to do was enabling the entities I wanted to work with. In this case, Items. It seems to be a rather straightforward manner to source data, as we have no need to create and manage API calls by setting up headers, body, parameter, etc. Everything is handled through the UI.

Data Variables

I have set a data variable called itemByBarcode, from the type "Collection of data records". Here, I configured a filter condition (where Barcode = scannedBarcode), and the fields as List of Values (ItemCode, ItemName, BarCode, ItemWarehouseInfoCollection).

Logic

The current logic consists on:

  1. Scan Barcode
  2. Store the scanned barcode in the page variable scannedBarcode
  3. Get Record Collection by using scannedBarcode variable
  4. Bind a data variable node to the itemByBarcode data variable

List Item

We added a list item called Warehouse List, and bind the "Repeat With" property to the formula data.itemByBarcode[0].ItemWarehouseInfoCollection. Inside of the list item, we placed a row with 4 cells, and each cell includes a text element where the warehouse data goes in (warehouse code, in stock, committed, ordered). The tree points to Row > Cell > Text, so there is no container aggregating the elements, which could potentially block the data flow.

The problem is that, even setting up the repeater in the outer list, I cannot see the individual fields to bind to each warehouse field, such as warehouse code, in stock, and so on. I tried to hardcode it via formula (e.g. current.WhsCode), but it doesn't work, as expected.

Also tried to bind via Data Item to repeat, and the nested data (Item > ItemWarehouseInfoCollection) doesn't appear to be available.

Outcomes

When previewing the App, at least I can see that the quantity of lines printed matches SAP. I even added a text to debug how many records are being fetch (quantity of warehouses), and it also matches (5), but the data itself still doesn't show up in the list.

Any comments or insights would be greatly appreciated! Thanks in anticipation!

BR,
Felipe

entry.title: Re: Delivery group functionality in Sales order item leve...
entry.content:
Please note the field VBAP-GRKOR (Delivery Group) does not trigger delivery split by itself in standard SAP. Instead, it is used to group items together that must be delivered in the same delivery, not to split them.

According to SAP Note 546668:

Delivery splits are triggered by differences in key fields that populate the delivery header. These include shipping point, route, incoterms, delivery date, and custom fields like ZUKRL,  but GRKOR is not a standard split criterion.

As suggested in the note, what you can do is you can pass the value to ZUKRL, based on GRKOR via copy control routine in Sales Order > Delivery. This field is used by SAP to force delivery splits. In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, you may need to use the BAdI SD_DELIVERY_SPLIT to implement custom split logic. This allows you to define your own criteria; including GRKOR, for splitting deliveries.

In short, the summary is

entry.title: TDS Configuration and deduction under Section 194C
entry.content:
• What configuration steps are required in SAP to enable both transaction-wise and annual cumulative TDS deduction as per Section 194C?
  • How do we set threshold limits for ₹30,000 per transaction and ₹1,00,000 annually?
  • Are there specific settings in Withholding Tax Type, Withholding Tax Code, or Condition Records that need to be updated? 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: TDS Configuration and deduction under Section 194C
entry.content:
Hi all,

 

TDS is deducted for 194C section if:

  • A single payment/invoice exceeds ₹30,000 (₹15,000 in case of payments to individual/HUF contractors for supply of labor).

  • Or the aggregate payments in a financial year to the same contractor exceed ₹1,00,000 (₹75,000 in case of payments to individual/HUF contractors for supply of labor).

 

Please find the below mandatory configuration activity,

104229 ---->>> Define Withholding Tax Keys

104225 ---->>> Define Withholding Tax Type for Invoice Posting

104226 ---->>> Define Withholding Tax Type for Payment Posting

104227 ---->>> Define Withholding Tax Codes

 

To use standard accumulation for TDS, assign the appropriate Withholding Tax Type and Code to the vendor using the 'Maintain Business Partner (Supplier)' app. Navigate to the Company Code view → Withholding Tax Data → Withholding Tax tab, and maintain the relevant TDS details.

 

Kindly note, we don't have exemption limit at transaction level for 194C section. TAN based exemptions cannot be used.

 

Best regards,

Atanu

SAP Support - S/4HANA Cloud

entry.title: AI-Assisted Calculations in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
We’re thrilled to announce the arrival of AI-Assisted Calculations in SAP Analytics Cloud—a transformative new feature designed to enhance your interaction with data. As part of our broader "AI First" strategy, this innovation harnesses generative AI to revolutionize how you create and comprehend complex calculations within the Calculation Dialog in SAP Analytics Cloud’s Data Analyzer, streamlining your data workflows and boosting analytical efficiency.

What Is It? 

AI-Assisted Calculations consists of two key functionalities within the calculation dialog: Generate and Explain. The Generate functionality simplifies the process of creating calculations by allowing you to use natural language to create a new calculation. The Explain functionality helps you understand existing calculations by providing a clear, natural language explanation. 

Key Benefits 

  1. Accelerate Calculation Creation: Instantly generate complex formulas using natural language queries, significantly reducing the time required for creating calculations and speeding up your workflow. 
  2. Simplify Calculation Understanding: Use the "Explain" feature to translate existing formulas into simple, easy-to-understand language, facilitating quick comprehension of complex calculations from colleagues or your own work. 
  3. Enhance User Experience: Leverage AI to simplify formula creation and explanation, making data analysis more intuitive and user-friendly, with future enhancements to resolve formula errors efficiently. 

How It Works

Generating a Calculation

The Generate functionality is a game-changer, allowing users to create complex calculations by simply describing what they need, rather than manually constructing formulas.

  1. In the Create Calculation or Edit Calculation dialog, open AI-Assisted Calculations. 
  2. In the formula requirement field, type your request using natural language. For example: "Calculate the Gross Margin Ratio" or "I need a formula to flag percentage values that deviate from the budget by more than 6%." 

  3. Click Generate. The AI will display a generated formula that you can review. 

  4. Once you're satisfied with the result, click Copy to Formula to use it in your calculation. 

Tip: For optimal accuracy in your calculations, provide clear and detailed requirements. Specify the exact dimensions and measures, and identify the specific members you are referring to. This precision will enhance the reliability of the generated calculations. 

Explaining a Calculation

The Explain functionality is perfect for understanding complex formulas created by others or refreshing your memory on your own work. 

  1. In the Edit Calculation dialog, the formula will appear in both the editor and the AI-Assisted Calculations tab. 
  2. Click Explain in the AI-Assisted Calculations. 
  3. The assistant will provide a clear, natural-language explanation of what the formula does. 

 This is especially helpful for understanding the business purpose behind a calculation and can be used to write a better description for the calculation itself, or just to understand it. 

Prerequisites 

This feature is part of the broader AI-Assisted Features suite in SAC and requires: 

  • A valid SAC license (BI or Planning) 
  • Business AI. See SAP Note 0003491182 . 
  • You must have purchased the SAP AI Units license. Please read the SAP Business AI catalog for more information, including factors for converting usage into SAP AI Units 
  • You must have the Execute permission for the Generative AI privilege. 

You can check that you have met all the necessary prerequisites, including activating the feature, as detailed here. . 

Looking Forward

This functionality will soon be available in the calculation editor within Story in SAP Analytics Cloud through the new Calculation Dialog. It holds immense potential for broader SAC implementations, especially where automated calculation creation is needed. We are committed to enhancing user workflows through continuous improvements and welcome your feedback and collaboration as part of our AI First strategy for SAC.

Thank you for your interest in AI-Assisted Calculations. We hope this new capability enhances your data analytics experience and invite your insights and feedback.

entry.title: Re: SAP Analytics Cloud - Data Actions - Advance Formula...
entry.content:
Hi @PS_1978

The statements for NEXT( - 1, "MONTH"), NEXT( - 1, "MONTH"), and NEXT( 0, "MONTH") can't be eliminated due to IF Condition [d/TIME].[p/MONTHDESC] = "Mar", "Jul", "Sep", and "Dec". 

Please refer to the script below, which eliminates script redundancy.

CONFIG.HIERARCHY.INCLUDE_MEMBERS_NOT_IN_HIERARCHY = [d/MEASURE_TYPE], [d/HRPOSITION], [d/GL_ACCOUNT], [d/DATASRC], [d/COSTCENTER]
CONFIG.HIERARCHY = [d/COSTCENTER].[h/DA_Prompt_H1]
MEMBERSET [d/DATASRC] = "UPLOAD"
MEMBERSET [d/CURRENCY] = "USD"
// MEMBERSET [d/GL_ACCOUNT] = "EMP_SALARY"
MEMBERSET [d/GL_ACCOUNT] = ("GL_1", "GL_2")
MEMBERSET [d/DATASRC] = (CALC - REG, CALC - MERIT)
MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "SALARY"
MEMBERSET [d/COMPANY] = %SelectCompany%
MEMBERSET [d/EMPCATE] = ("Full Time", "New", "Part Time")
MEMBERSET [d/TIME] = NEXT(0, "MONTH", %CutOffMonth%) TO NEXT(%NumberOfMonths%, "MONTH", %CutOffMonth%)

IF [d/TIME].[p/MONTHDESC] = "Mar" OR [d/TIME].[p/MONTHDESC] = "Jun" OR [d/TIME].[p/MONTHDESC] = "Sep" OR [d/TIME].[p/MONTHDESC] = "Dec"
	THEN
	IF [d/HRPOSITION].[p/NEWPOS_FLAG] = "Y" THEN
		// For the New employee % to be read from assumption Table	
		DATA([d/DATASRC] = "CALC-REG", [d/GL_ACCOUNT] = "GL_SALARIED") =
		  (RESULTLOOKUP([d/TIME] = NEXT( - 1, "MONTH"))
		 + RESULTLOOKUP([d/TIME] = NEXT( - 2, "MONTH"))
		 + RESULTLOOKUP([d/TIME] = NEXT(0, "MONTH")))
		* (RESULTLOOKUP([d/MEASURE_TYPE] = [d/HRPOSITION].[p/CORP_GRADE], [d/DATASRC] = "INPUT", [d/Measures] = "PERCENTAGE", [d/GL_ACCOUNT] = "#", [d/CURRENCY] = "#", [d/COSTCENTER] = "#", [d/HRPOSITION] = "#", [d/EMPLOYEE] = "#", [d/START_DATE] = "2200-12-31", [d/END_DATE] = "2200-12-31", [d/SHIFT] = "#", [d/TERM_DATE] = "2200-12-31", [d/GRADE] = "#", [d/EMPCATE] = "#", [d/EMPSTAT] = "#", [d/LABOR_TYPE] = "#"))
	ELSE
		// For the existing employee % to be read from emp attribute	
		DATA([d/DATASRC] = "CALC-REG", [d/GL_ACCOUNT] = "GL_SALARIED") =
		 ((RESULTLOOKUP([d/TIME] = NEXT( - 1, "MONTH"))
		 + RESULTLOOKUP([d/TIME] = NEXT( - 2, "MONTH"))
		 + RESULTLOOKUP([d/TIME] = NEXT(0, "MONTH")))
		 * (ATTRIBUTE([d/HRPOSITION].[p/CORP_BONUS]))) / 100
	ENDIF
ENDIF

I hope this is helpful to you, and if I have misunderstood anything, please feel free to reach out.

Moonjun

entry.title: Re: How to get single property from a nested structure using $select in Odata API Call
entry.content:
Hi there,

without accessing an SAP system right now, I've tried to replicate the behavior using the Northwind V4 service. As far as I know (though be it unverified) the V4 Northwind API isn't fully V4 compliant so take the result with a grain of salt.

I took the base query of `https://services.odata.org/v4/northwind/northwind.svc/Orders?$expand=Order_Details` so that I can replicate your nested scenario (is that is what you meant by nested entity(?), again sorry I currently don't have access to an SAP system).

Now I added the `$select` to the expand (nested property) so that I may retrieve only a subset of properties. That now looks like this, using: `https://services.odata.org/v4/northwind/northwind.svc/Orders?$select=OrderID&$expand=Order_Details($select=ProductID)`. 

If you're looking at complex types or collection of complex types wrt nesting, please have a look at the V4 OData specification (which is awesome) at: https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part2-url-conventions.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionselect more specifically maybe "Example 130" is what you're looking for.

Hth~ Marco

entry.title: Re: Payment methods when the bank account is in a foreign...
entry.content:
In order to handle Payment Methods with Foreign Bank Accounts, try with the below steps.

  • Create the House Bank with the country code of the bank’s location which is US. Assign the Account ID with the correct currency as USD. Link the House Bank to the UK company code. This is allowed even if the bank is in another country.
  • In FBZP, enable Foreign Currency Allowed and Foreign Business Partner Allowed.
  • Assign the payment method and currency USD to the foreign House Bank. You can also leave the currency field blank to allow all currencies, but test this carefully.
  • The bank G/L account must allow postings in the relevant foreign currency which is USD. If the G/L account is restricted to company code currency which is GBP, you’ll get posting errors.

entry.title: Re: IDNFBRJ_1BNFAGRI_DEFEN Missing
entry.content:
You say, you were trying to implement the two SAP notes. Does it mean, it has not been implemented yet? If implemented and still, if you have issues, then, it means that during the implementation of SAP Note 3560404 (prerequisite for 3560477, which introduces the Agriculture and Livestock tab for NF-e), the system is referencing a field that has not been properly created or activated.

Root causes could be

Missing Dictionary Object: The field IDNFBRJ_1BNFAGRI_DEFEN may not have been created in the data dictionary (SE11), or the structure it belongs to wasn’t activated.
Incorrect Include or Structure Reference: The include LJ1BBTOP might be referencing the wrong structure or outdated version.
Field Renaming or Replacement: SAP may have renamed the field to XJ_1BNFAGRI_DEFEN in the final version of the note, and the implementation is still referencing the old name.

Areas to be checked

  • Go to transaction SNOTE, verify that SAP Note 3560404 and 3560477 are fully implemented. Reapply or reset the note if needed
  • Go to SE11, search for the structure that should contain IDNFBRJ_1BNFAGRI_DEFEN. If it’s missing, check if XJ_1BNFAGRI_DEFEN is the correct field and update the include accordingly

entry.title: Re: SAP Integration Suite- Deep dive into Content Modifier
entry.content:
Neither the ${body.replaceAll('@','')} nor the ${body.replaceAll('\@','')} was working for me.

The solution was a simple Groovy Script:

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;
def Message processData(Message message) {
def body = message.getBody(String);
body = body.replaceAll('@','');
message.setBody(body);
return message;
}

entry.title: Re: edocument hungary - Validation Warning from NAV /SAP...
entry.content:
Hello @SebastianB 

Here’s how to resolve this in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition (DRC – Hungary e-Invoicing). The problem is a 1 HUF rounding discrepancy between line-level rounding (SAP) and summary-level validation (NAV). Address it by matching the rounding and, if necessary, adjusting the payload in the HU mapping BAdI.

1) Confirm it’s a rounding mismatch

In eDocument Cockpit, open the invoice → Preview Payload.

Compare the sum of the rounded line nets with:

invoiceSummary/invoiceNetAmount

summaryByVatRate/vatRateNetAmount per VAT rate
If the difference is ±1 HUF, proceed.

2) Check Hungary rounding configuration (no code)

App: Set Up Local Settings – Hungary

Rounding method = commercial

Rounding level = item (line-level)

Tax codes: Define Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases

Ensure VAT % is exactly 27.00 / 18.00 / 5.00 (no extra decimals).

Recreate the eDocument and re-test.
If warnings persist, implement the mapping fix.

3) Implement HU payload mapping adjustment (Public Cloud BAdI)

App: Custom Logic

Business context: Document & Reporting Compliance – Hungary eInvoice

BAdI (example name): Mapping for Hungary eInvoice

(In S/4 HANA Public Cloud, SAP provides a country-specific DRC mapping enhancement point. Use the HU mapping BAdI exposed in Custom Logic for payload mapping.)

Goal: overwrite the summary nodes so they equal the sum of the rounded item nets.

Follow the ABAP for key steps below:
DATA: lv_sum_item_net TYPE p DECIMALS 0,
lv_sum_rate_net TYPE p DECIMALS 0.

"1) Sum rounded item nets"
lv_sum_item_net = REDUCE #( INIT x = 0
FOR ls_item IN it_items
NEXT x = x + round( ls_item-net_amount, 0 ) ).

"2) For each VAT rate, sum rounded nets of items with that rate"
LOOP AT it_vat_rates INTO DATA(ls_rate).
lv_sum_rate_net = REDUCE #( INIT x = 0
FOR ls_item IN it_items WHERE ( vat_rate = ls_rate-rate )
NEXT x = x + round( ls_item-net_amount, 0 ) ).

"3) Overwrite summaryByVatRate/vatRateNetAmount"
es_payload-summaryByVatRate[ rate = ls_rate-rate ]-vatRateNetAmount = lv_sum_rate_net.
ENDLOOP.

"4) Overwrite invoiceSummary/invoiceNetAmount"
es_payload-invoiceSummary-invoiceNetAmount = lv_sum_item_net.

"5) Recalculate dependent totals if structure requires it (tax base, tax amount)"

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

You can check these SAP Documentations for your reference

GenAI Assist content 

Document and Reporting Compliance-SAP Help

3557761 - Hungary invoice failed with NAV errors

entry.title: Sales in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP's ready-to-run public Cloud ERP software solution.  

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data, and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the Cloud ERP ecosystem–customers, partners, and SAP experts. 

This blog shares highlights on Sales in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.

  • Advanced down payment processing for delivery-related scenarios
  • Flexible Account Determination for Reconciliation and Cash Settlement
  • Display and edit of price elements in Manage Preliminary Billing Documents - Services app
  • Returns Order OData v4 API: enhancements such as creation with reference and creation for advanced variant configuration
  • Customer returns for sales kits with warehouse management
  • Managing Price Agreements in Sales Contracts - 2508 Scope
  • Debit Memo Request OData V4 API - create without reference, initial scope to include pricing elements, partner entities, and more
  • Creation and editing of sales orders without charge with the Fiori app 'Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2'
  • Credit memo requests and debit memo requests with variant configuration (single material)
  • Cloud BAdI to modify sales document data in finalize phase before save
  • CDS view and API for material listing and exclusion
  • Integration of payment by link in sales billing (Release 2502.1)
  • Handling expiring prices with Joule (Release 2502.2)
  • Creation of customer invoice before posting of goods issue (Release 2502.2)
  • Joule: AI-assisted sales order status check (Release 2502.3)

Watch my video to get a glimpse of the new features:

 

 

Advanced down payment processing for delivery-related scenarios

Advanced down payment processing for delivery-related scenarios allows businesses to efficiently manage customer down payments with reference to outbound deliveries, using rule-based determination to address diverse business needs.

This feature delivers tangible financial and operational benefits by reducing exposure to credit risk and helping maintain strong liquidity through upfront collections tied directly to deliveries. It increases accuracy, transparency, and flexibility in how down payments are settled, enabling businesses to clear exactly the right amounts at the desired level of granularity. Preconfigured logistics-focused content accelerates time to value while remaining easy to tailor to specific policies and processes. A streamlined, intuitive user experience guides users step by step and surfaces detailed information throughout, improving control, auditability, and user productivity.

It provides a robust, rules-driven framework for managing down payments in delivery-related scenarios. Businesses can initiate and process customer down payments with explicit reference to outbound deliveries, apply rule-based determination to select the appropriate process variant for diverse requirements, and orchestrate execution through the billing plan. Settlement leverages the condition technique, providing powerful flexibility to calculate, allocate, and reconcile down payments precisely as needed across different delivery and billing contexts.

We will explain this feature in detail in the upcoming SAP S/4HANA Product Expert Training  Please register for the Sales session. The session is open to SAP Partners. 

Figure: Advanced down payment processing for delivery-related scenarios

Figure: Advanced down payment processing for delivery-related scenarios

 

Flexible Account Determination for Reconciliation and Cash Settlement

This feature provides the flexibility to tailor general ledger (G/L) account determination to meet specific country or industry standards, ensuring accurate financial postings. By automating complex reconciliation and cash settlement processes, it significantly reduces manual labor, leading to cost savings and scalability as business needs evolve.

This feature delivers significant operational efficiency and cost savings by automating the complex process of general ledger account determination for different countries and industries. By eliminating the need for extensive manual labor in billing, clerks, and accountants, organizations can achieve substantial reductions in labor costs while improving scalability as their business evolves. The flexibility to customize account determination based on specific country or industry standards ensures accurate financial postings and regulatory compliance, while the automation of reconciliation and cash settlement processes reduces human error and accelerates financial operations.

The feature enables organizations to set up configurable condition tables with both predefined standard fields and custom fields to tailor general ledger account determination to their specific requirements. Users can post billing documents to alternative reconciliation accounts or directly to cash accounts based on these configurable conditions, ensuring accurate posting to the correct financial accounts. The system supports the creation of custom fields to accommodate new product lines, business locations, or accounting practices without requiring a complete system overhaul, and allows modification of existing determination tables as business needs change and evolve.

Watch this demo to have a complete view of the feature.

 

Demo: Flexible Account Determination for Reconciliation and Cash Settlement

 

Display and edit of price elements in Manage Preliminary Billing Documents - Services app (Professional Services)

The feature allows project-billing specialists or billing team members to efficiently manage pricing conditions at both the header and item levels, enabling quick adaptations through an intuitive user interface.

This feature delivers significant operational benefits by streamlining the billing process for project-billing specialists and billing teams. By reducing the time required for pricing adaptations through an intuitive interface, organizations can achieve faster billing cycles and improved process efficiency. The ability to make quick pricing adjustments directly translates to reduced administrative overhead, faster revenue recognition, and enhanced responsiveness to project changes or client requirements.

The feature introduces a new pricing elements facet that empowers users to manage pricing conditions at both header and item levels within preliminary billing documents. Users can display existing price conditions, create new ones, and modify or delete manually created price conditions as needed. The system supports comprehensive pricing updates, allowing users to adjust prices for all items at the header level or make targeted changes to individual line items, providing granular control over billing document pricing structure.

Figure: Display and edit of price elements in Manage Preliminary Billing Documents - Services app

Figure: Display and edit of price elements in Manage Preliminary Billing Documents - Services app

 

Returns Order OData v4 API: enhancements such as creation with reference and creation for advanced variant configuration

With the "Customer Return (A2X)" OData V4 API, you can now do the following:
  • Create returns orders with reference to preceding documents, such as sales orders, sales orders without charge, or invoices.
  • Create returns orders for configurable materials that use advanced variant configuration (AVC).
  • Help Document: Create with Reference
  • Help Document: Variant Configuration

The enhanced Returns Order OData v4 API delivers significant operational flexibility for businesses managing customer returns processes. By enabling the creation of returns orders with direct references to preceding documents like sales orders and invoices, organizations can streamline their returns workflow and maintain better traceability throughout the customer service lifecycle. Additionally, support for advanced variant configuration (AVC) materials ensures that companies selling complex, configurable products can efficiently process returns for customized items, reducing manual processing time and improving customer satisfaction through faster return handling.

 

Customer returns for sales kits with warehouse management

With this feature, you can process the returns of sales kits in Warehouse Management. You can enter a storage location that is managed by Warehouse Management in a returns order item or returns delivery. The storage location specified in the main item of a returns order item is copied to all its subitems. You can change the storage location at the subitem level.

This feature significantly enhances the end-to-end customer experience by streamlining the returns process for sales kits across all four available variants (ERLA, LUMF, CPFH, and DISH). By integrating customer returns with warehouse management systems, businesses can provide more efficient and consistent handling of returned sales kits, reducing processing time and improving customer satisfaction. The feature enables regular logistical follow-up activities, ensuring better visibility and control over the returns process while maintaining operational efficiency throughout the entire returns lifecycle.

The feature allows users to process sales kit returns directly within the Warehouse Management system by enabling the specification of warehouse-managed storage locations in returns orders and deliveries. When a storage location is defined at the main item level of a returns order, the system automatically propagates this location to all associated subitems, ensuring consistency across the entire sales kit. Users retain the flexibility to modify storage locations at the individual subitem level when needed, providing granular control over where different components of the returned sales kit are stored and managed within the warehouse infrastructure.

Graphic: Customer returns for sales kits with warehouse managementFigure: Customer returns for sales kits with warehouse management

Check out the presentation and demo for details.

  • Presentation: EKT_returns_and_warehouse_integration_for_sales_kits
  • Demo: Returns_and_Warehoue_Integration_E2E_Demo

We will explain this feature in detail in the upcoming SAP S/4HANA Product Expert Training . Please register for the Sales session. The session is open to SAP Partners. 

 

Managing Price Agreements in Sales Contracts - 2508 Scope

The price agreement processing for sales contract allows business to efficiently mange the sales contract specific prices or discounts per product hierarchy and its nodes. With the automatic contract assignment in subsequent sales order processing, the price agreements is applied to sales orders items with certain product hierarchy determinations.

The price agreement processing feature delivers significant operational efficiency by automating the management of product-specific pricing and discounts across sales contracts. This automation reduces manual effort in maintaining dummy products within value contracts while providing an intuitive user experience for managing complex product hierarchies and their associated pricing agreements. The streamlined processing increases efficiency in both sales contract integrations and sales order operations, enabling businesses to offer targeted special pricing to end customers based on specific product hierarchy nodes while minimizing administrative overhead.

The feature enables comprehensive product hierarchy and price agreement maintenance within value contracts through both the Fiori UI and OData V4 API. It supports automatic contract assignment during sales order processing, where the system can determine product hierarchy based on input products and automatically match contract items to products or product hierarchy nodes. Key capabilities include maintaining product hierarchy nodes on sales contract items, determining appropriate price agreements in sales orders, and enabling sales contract automatic assignment functionality that applies relevant pricing structures based on product hierarchy determinations during order processing.

Watch this demo to have a complete view of the feature.

 

Demo: Managing Price Agreements in Sales Contracts - 2508 Scope

 

Debit Memo Request OData V4 API - create without reference, initial scope to include pricing elements, partner entities, and more

The OData V4 API Debit Memo Request (A2X) offers both synchronous and asynchronous processing, and makes the data of debit memo requests available through its header, item, partner, pricing element, and text entities. With this service, you can do the following:

  • Create debit memo requests from scratch.
  • Read entire debit memo requests or only parts of the data, using the provided filters.
  • Create, read, and update debit memo requests with subentities, or delete subentitites for existing debit memo requests. Subentities include header partner, header pricing element, header text, item, item partner, item pricing element, and item text.

The Debit Memo Request OData v4 API enables organizations to efficiently manage debit memo requests programmatically, supporting end-to-end automation and seamless integration with external systems. By leveraging the ABAP RESTful application programming model and the latest OData v4 protocol, it delivers a modern, scalable interface for creating and maintaining debit memo requests, improving process agility and data consistency. Support for both synchronous and asynchronous processing provides flexibility for real-time and background use cases, helping reduce manual effort, accelerate billing adjustments, and ensure accurate partner, pricing, and textual context is captured and maintained.

The API exposes core debit memo request entities, including the header and item, along with their related subentities: partner, pricing elements, and text at both header and item levels. It supports creation without reference (creating debit memo requests from scratch), reading entire requests or selective subsets via filters, and managing subentities with fine-grained operations. Specifically, you can create, read, and update debit memo requests and their subentities—header partner, header pricing element, header text, item, item partner, item pricing element, and item text—or delete subentities for existing requests. Processing is available in synchronous and asynchronous modes to suit different integration patterns.

  • Help Document: Debit Memo Request (A2X, OData V4)

 

Creation and editing of sales orders without charge with the Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2 app (F2305A)

With this lightweight app, you can create, change, or display sales orders without charge containing key information in a fast and easy way. You can do so directly within the Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2 app, whereas in the Manage Sales Orders Without Charge app that was already available before, you need to navigate to other apps. You can also list all sales orders without charge, filter the results, or search for specific sales orders without charge.

  • Help Document: Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2

The app boosts speed, efficiency, and flexibility for handling zero-value sales processes. By enabling end-to-end creation and editing of Delivery Free of Charge orders (CBFD) and streamlined display of Replacement Delivery Orders (SD2) in a single, lightweight interface, it reduces clicks and context switching. Quick actions and mass data entry via XLS cut-and-paste accelerate daily work, while key-user adaptation ensures the UI aligns with company best practices—improving user productivity, data quality, and time-to-value with minimal IT involvement.

The app lets users create, change, and display sales orders without charge directly within the app, eliminating the need to navigate to other apps. It supports efficient creation and editing for CBFD orders and display capability for SD2 orders, and offers listing, filtering, and search to quickly find relevant orders. Key-user adaptation allows showing, hiding, or rearranging standard and extension fields to tailor the UI. Quick actions streamline common tasks, and XLS cut-and-paste enables fast mass entry of item data for high-volume scenarios.

Figure: Creation and editing of sales orders without charge with the Fiori app 'Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2'

Figure: Creation and editing of sales orders without charge with the Fiori app 'Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2'

 

Credit memo requests and debit memo requests with variant configuration (single material)

With this feature, you can process the credit memo requests and debit memo requests with configurable materials that use advanced variant configuration (AVC) ordered by a customer.
Variant configuration is used for the manufacturing of complex products with many variants (for example, cars, where customers can choose from long lists of options and possible combinations). For more information, see Advanced Variant Configuration.

This feature streamlines post-sales adjustments for configurable products by enabling credit memo requests and debit memo requests for materials using advanced variant configuration (AVC). Organizations can process pricing-correct and configuration-aware credits/debits for a single configurable material without manual rework, improving cycle times, accuracy, and user experience. It reduces errors from re-entering configurations, ensures consistent variant-driven pricing, and supports industries with complex, option-rich products by aligning claims and corrections with the exact configuration the customer ordered.

The new scope item allows creation of credit memo requests and debit memo requests for single-level configurable materials, either with or without reference to preceding documents. It supports variant configuration explosion within the request so that the selected characteristics and components are reflected in the document structure. Pricing determination leverages the variant configuration, ensuring that configuration-dependent prices and surcharges are correctly applied. The capability is designed for single-level materials using AVC, covering both credit and debit processes with configuration-aware document handling.

We will explain this feature in detail in the upcoming SAP S/4HANA Product Expert Training . Please register for the Sales session. The session is open to SAP Partners. 

 

Cloud BAdI to modify sales document data in finalize phase before save

With the Modification of Sales Document in Finalize Phase before Save (SD_SLS_FINALIZE) BAdI, you can set or change custom fields at the sales order header and item level. You can also set or change the rejection reason at the sales document item level. This BAdI is only called for sales orders and sales orders without charge. It is not called when the sales document is processed indirectly by processes such as credit management, backorder processing, the creation of advanced intercompany sales orders, or other similar processes.

This cloud BAdI enhances extensibility and control over sales documents in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition by letting customers enforce company-specific rules and build process variants without heavy custom development. By running only in the finalize phase before save, it minimizes performance impact while ensuring critical custom fields are validated or derived consistently, improving data quality and user experience. It empowers organizations to tailor behavior for standard sales orders and sales orders without charge, supporting nuanced business scenarios and governance needs.

The Modification of Sales Document in Finalize Phase before Save BAdI (SD_SLS_FINALIZE) allows setting or changing custom fields at the sales order header and item levels, and adjusting the rejection reason at item level. The BAdI grants access to key sales document data—including header, item, and schedule line—so customers can compute values prior to persistence. It is applicable in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and is invoked only for sales orders and sales orders without charge, not for indirectly processed scenarios such as credit management, backorder processing, or advanced intercompany sales. This ensures targeted execution at save time to reliably influence header and item custom fields.

Check out the presentation and help document for more details. 

  • Presentation: EKT_Sales_Order_BAdI_Finalize
  • Help Document: Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) for Sales Documents

 

CDS view and API for material listing and exclusion

API for Sales Material Listing & Exclusion Conditions
The inbound service Condition Record for Material Listing and Exclusion in Sales (A2X, OData V4) enables you to create, read, update, and delete condition records for material listing and exclusion from external systems.
  • Help Document: Condition Record for Material Listing and Exclusion in Sales (A2X, OData V4)
  • Presentation: EKT_OData_API_Sales_Listing_and_Exclusion_CE25023
CDS view extractor for material listing and exclusion
The CDS view Condition Record for Material Listing and Exclusion (I_SLSMATLLSTGOREXCLSNRECORD) retrieves the condition records (based on standard or custom condition tables) for material listing and exclusion.
  • Help Document: Condition Record for Material Listing and Exclusion

This capability streamlines governance over which materials can be sold to which customers by providing a standard OData V4 API to maintain sales-material listing and exclusion condition records in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. It enables efficient, automated master data maintenance and checks within sales documents, improving compliance, reducing order-entry errors, and accelerating processing. External systems can seamlessly integrate to create and update rules programmatically, while a CDS-based extractor supports reliable replication and analytics in downstream platforms through both full and delta modes.

The inbound OData V4 service “Condition Record for Material Listing and Exclusion in Sales” (A2X) supports synchronous and asynchronous processing to create, read, update, and delete condition records for material listing and exclusion from external systems. For data extraction and analysis, the CDS view “Condition Record for Material Listing and Exclusion” (I_SLSMATLLSTGOREXCLSNRECORD) retrieves condition records based on standard or custom condition tables and supports full and delta extraction, enabling efficient data transfer to external consumers. 

 

Integration of payment by link in sales billing

With this feature, you can generate a payment link in the form of a QR code on the output of your billing documents, for example, on the printed invoice. By scanning the code, your customers can access a payment page to settle the payment using various digital payment types. This feature is provided by the SAP digital payments add-on, which connects with payment service providers (PSPs) to facilitate the secure, end-to-end processing of digital payments.

This feature delivers significant business value by accelerating cash flow and improving customer satisfaction through streamlined payment processes. By embedding payment links or QR codes directly on billing documents like invoices, companies can reduce payment delays and friction in the collection process. Customers benefit from a simplified, modern payment experience that eliminates the need for manual payment entry or check writing, while businesses see faster settlement of outstanding receivables and reduced administrative overhead in payment processing.

The integration of payment by link functionality within SAP Sales Billing automatically generates QR codes on billing document outputs such as printed invoices. When customers scan these codes with their mobile devices, they are directed to a secure payment page that supports multiple digital payment methods. The feature leverages SAP's digital payments add-on, which seamlessly connects with various payment service providers (PSPs) to ensure secure, end-to-end transaction processing. This integration maintains data integrity within the SAP environment while providing customers with immediate access to convenient payment options directly from their billing documents.

Check out the following presentations and help document.

  • Presentation: EKT_Integration_of_Payment_By_Link_in_Sales_Billing_25021CE
  • Help Document: Payment by Link in Billing Documents

Watch this demo to have a complete view of the feature.

 

Demo: Integration of payment by link in sales billing

 

Handling expiring prices with Joule

You can ask Joule to fetch prices (stored as condition records for pricing in sales in the system) that will expire soon. For expiring prices, Joule can help renew them by extending their validity periods and adjusting the condition amounts or ratios according to your requirements.

You can ask Joule to perform the following tasks:

  • Fetch and display prices approaching expiration based on certain criteria.
  • Extend valid-to dates by a period or to a specific date.
  • Adjust condition amounts or ratios proportionally for the new validity period.
  • Create new condition records for the price renewal in a single job.
  • Track the job progress.
  • Open prices and job details in the "Manage Prices - Sales" app.

This feature delivers substantial business value by preventing revenue loss and pricing errors through proactive expiration management and streamlined price maintenance. By leveraging Joule's conversational AI capabilities, pricing specialists can identify expiring prices, discounts, and surcharges before they become invalid, eliminating costly pricing corrections and potential lost sales opportunities. The natural language interface dramatically reduces the time required to create and update pricing conditions from hours to seconds, enabling pricing teams to be more responsive to market changes while maintaining pricing accuracy and consistency across the organization.

The expiring price handling feature powered by Joule enables users to interact conversationally with the AI assistant to monitor and manage pricing condition records in SAP. Users can query Joule to identify prices, discounts, or surcharges approaching expiration within specified timeframes (days, months, or years) and receive comprehensive displays of these conditions. Joule facilitates price renewal by extending validity periods to specific dates or by duration, adjusting condition amounts through percentage increases or decreases, and maintaining existing values as needed. The system creates new condition records through a single conversational job, provides real-time progress tracking, and seamlessly integrates with the "Manage Prices - Sales" app for detailed review and further modifications.

Check out the following demo and help document.

  • Demo: Renew_Product_Prices_with_Joule_Internal
  • Help Document: Renew Expiring Prices

Watch this demo to have a complete view of the feature.

 

Demo: Handling expiring prices with Joule

 

Creation of customer invoice before posting of goods issue

Create a new scope item that enables the customer invoice to be created before the goods issue is posted through the following sequence of process steps:

  • Creation of a sales order, including availability check
  • Creation of the subsequent invoice before goods issue has taken place
  • Posting of goods issue while the invoice already exists

This new scope item increases process flexibility by allowing organizations to create the customer invoice before goods issue is posted. It helps companies prepare required billing documents earlier in the order-to-cash cycle, improving their ability to fulfill export documentation needs and adhere to international customs regulations. By decoupling invoice creation from physical shipment, businesses can reduce delays related to documentation and ensure smoother cross-border processing.

The scope item defines a controlled sequence of process steps: first, create the sales order with an availability check; second, create the subsequent customer invoice before goods issue has taken place; and finally, post the goods issue while the invoice already exists. This process variant enables billing to occur ahead of logistics completion, providing the necessary invoice documentation in advance while preserving standard posting of goods issue thereafter.

Figure: Creation of customer invoice before posting of goods issue

Figure: Creation of customer invoice before posting of goods issue

 

Joule: AI-assisted sales order status check

Joule allows you to check whether a sales order's fulfillment is on track and identify the issues that block its fulfillment. For each sales order, Joule can tell whether such issues exist in the order processing phase. If yes, you can display issue details, view possible causes and handling suggestions for each issue, and navigate to related apps.

This feature significantly enhances operational efficiency by providing instant, natural language insights into sales order fulfillment status and accelerating issue resolution. By translating complex fulfillment data into easily understandable language, Joule empowers sales teams, customer service representatives, and order management staff to quickly identify bottlenecks and take corrective action. This leads to improved customer satisfaction through faster order processing, reduced fulfillment delays, and more proactive communication about order status. The intuitive AI-driven approach eliminates the need for users to navigate complex system screens or interpret technical status codes, resulting in faster response times and more efficient order management workflows.

The AI-assisted Sales Order Status Check feature enables users to interact with Joule using natural language queries to assess sales order fulfillment progress and identify blocking issues. Joule analyzes the sales order processing pipeline and translates technical fulfillment statuses into conversational responses that clearly indicate whether orders are on track or experiencing delays. When issues are detected, the system provides detailed explanations of each problem, suggests potential root causes, and offers specific handling recommendations for resolution. Users can seamlessly navigate from Joule's analysis to relevant SAP applications for deeper investigation or corrective action, creating an integrated workflow that bridges conversational AI insights with traditional system functionality.

Check for details in the help document: Help Document: Sales Order Status Check

Watch this demo to have a complete view of the feature.

 

Demo: Joule: AI-assisted sales order status check

entry.title: Re: Employee Replication from S/4HANA Cloud Public Editio...
entry.content:
Hello @klicklas 

In the SAP-managed S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ↔ Sales Cloud V2 integration (part of SAP Grow Premium), there is currently no standard iFlow available for directly replicating Employee master data from S/4HANA Public Cloud to Sales Cloud V2. This contrasts with the on-premises S/4HANA → C4C package, which includes a dedicated Replicate Employee iFlow.

Recommendation:

  • If you utilize SuccessFactors, replicate employees from SuccessFactors to both systems using IAM, which is the recommended SAP method.
  • If you do not use SuccessFactors, create a custom iFlow in SAP Cloud Integration by using below
  • Source: API_WORKFORCE_PERSON from S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.
  • Target: Sales Cloud V2 Employee/User OData service.
  • Include mapping for BP role BUP003 and required login/ownership fields.

With kind regards

Chuma
